questions.question: What does the Pumping Lemma aim to establish in the context of context-free grammars?

answers.a: The existence of a regular language.
answers.b: The non-existence of a context-free language.
answers.c: The equivalence of two context-free languages.
answers.d: The minimization of a context-free grammar.

explanations.b: Correct! The Pumping Lemma is used to show the non-existence of certain context-free languages.

questions.question: What type of languages does the Pumping Lemma apply to?

explanations.b: Correct! The Pumping Lemma is specifically applicable to context-free languages.

questions.question: What is the main purpose of using the Pumping Lemma in the study of context-free grammars?

answers.a: To prove the regularity of a language.
answers.c: To demonstrate the closure properties of context-free languages.
answers.d: To establish the complexity of a grammar.

explanations.b: Correct! The Pumping Lemma is used to identify certain properties of context-free languages.
